text: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
The unexamined life is not worth living.
If you speak the truth, have a foot in the stirrup. Truth-tellers should be ready for a quick escape.
Friendship doubles our joy and divides our grief. Mathematics cannot explain this miracle.
A true friend stabs you in the front, not in the back. Either way, avoid friends with knives.
Walking with a friend in the dark is better than walking alone in the light. Unless that friend keeps tripping over things.
The best mirror is an old friend. They reflect who you truly are, even when you don't want to see it.
Friendship is born at that moment when one person says to another, 'What! You too? I thought I was the only one.'
No person is your friend who demands your silence, or denies your right to grow. Or who borrows money and never returns it.
A real friend is one who walks in when the rest of the world walks out. Then they help you hide the evidence.
Friends are the family you choose. Choose wisely, or holidays will be just as awkward.
The meeting of two personalities is like the contact of two chemical substances: if there is any reaction, both are transformed. Sometimes this creates wisdom, sometimes a large explosion.
Misfortune shows those who are not really friends. Prosperity shows those who should not be friends.
Friends are like stars; you don't always see them, but you know they're always there. Unlike stars, they also borrow your things and forget to return them.
A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you. This is the rarest form of magic.

The glory of friendship is not the outstretched hand, nor the kindly smile, nor the joy of companionship; it is the spiritual inspiration that comes when you discover that someone else believes in you.
The wise man doesn't give the right answers, he poses the right questions. The true friend listens to both.
Shared joy is a double joy; shared sorrow is half a sorrow. Shared wisdom is usually ignored by both parties.
The only way to have a friend is to be one. The easiest way to lose one is to borrow money.
A brother may not be a friend, but a friend will always be a brother. Unless you borrow his favorite horse without asking.
A friend is someone with whom you dare to be yourself. An enemy is often someone who once fit this description.
The circle of friendship is a sacred place, enter with reverence. Exit with explanations.
One of the most beautiful qualities of true friendship is to understand and to be understood. This often requires learning a friend's unique language of grunts and gestures.
There is nothing on this earth more to be prized than true friendship. Except perhaps a friend who owns a vineyard.
The friendship that can cease has never been real. The friendship that never disagrees was never honest.
Friendship multiplies the good of life and divides the evil. Unfortunately, it also multiplies the number of unexpected dinner guests.
The bond that links your true family is not one of blood, but of respect and joy in each other's life. And occasionally, shared complaining about the same people.
Integrity is doing the right thing, even when no one is watching.
The true measure of a man is how he treats someone who can do him absolutely no good.
A beautiful face will age and a perfect body will change, but a beautiful soul will always be beautiful.
The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give.
The two most important days in your life are the day you are born and the day you find out why.
Every action of our lives touches on some chord that will vibrate in eternity.
The best portion of a good man's life is his little, nameless, unremembered acts of kindness and of love.
You will face many defeats in life, but never let yourself be defeated.
The purpose of life is not to be happy. It is to be useful, to be honorable, to be compassionate, to have it make some difference that you have lived and lived well.
The wise man doesn't give the right answers, he poses the right questions.
Virtue is bold, and goodness never fearful.
It is not what we take up, but what we give up, that makes us rich.
Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
The mark of the immature man is that he wants to die nobly for a cause, while the mark of a mature man is that he wants to live humbly for one.
The quality of a person's life is in direct proportion to their commitment to excellence, regardless of their chosen field of endeavor.
The ultimate measure of a man is not where he stands in moments of comfort and convenience, but where he stands at times of challenge and controversy.
The greatest good you can do for another is not just to share your riches but to reveal to him his own.
Do not seek to follow in the footsteps of the wise. Seek what they sought.

Watch your thoughts, they become words. Watch your words, they become actions. Watch your actions, they become habits. Watch your habits, they become character. Watch your character, it becomes your destiny.
The beauty of a living thing is not the atoms that go into it, but the way those atoms are put together.
The arc of the moral universe is long, but it bends toward justice.
It is not in the stars to hold our destiny but in ourselves.
When I do good, I feel good. When I do bad, I feel bad. That is my religion.
The beauty of a sunrise is that it sees no race, creed, or status, but shines equally on all who witness it.
The meaning of life is to find your gift. The purpose of life is to give it away.
How far that little candle throws its beams! So shines a good deed in a weary world.
The oak fought the wind and was broken, the willow bent when it must and survived.
When we seek to discover the best in others, we somehow bring out the best in ourselves.
The more you know yourself, the more clarity there is. Self-knowledge has no end.
The true sign of intelligence is not knowledge but imagination.
The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
